CIO -- Dianne: professional relationship, has been consultant. 
PSKS -- Alexis Laird: "It may not be useful for me to be in the room when deciding on this agency.  I have ideological and professional differences with how this agency has worked in the past, and I feel I'm unable to reconcile this and decide more "objectively".**  Lastly, question their soundness, in the fall they had some very scary financial issues.  Not sure how it looks now."
NOT CONFLICT:
APANO -- Dianne & Nancy are members; Nancy is active volunteer and works w/ them thru WSC. 
API Chaya -- Anthony Ricardi: "API Chaya collaborates with the NW Network and I have very close ties to the Network (my best friend/former partner is Kristin Tucker who runs programs there, also I've worked as a consultant with them on their training for health care workers).  Not sure that connection would affect our funding, but want to put it out there."; Mijo is a friend of program coordinator Lil Snoopy Fujikawa.

fields.title: Immigration Reform (Summer)
fields.conflicts:
Entre Hermanos - Joaquin
OneAmerica - Joaquin
21 PROGRESS - Joaquin
fields.extra_question:
Social Justice Fund NW is interested in funding ongoing community organizing for immigrant rights and strong immigrant communities. We believe that because of the possibility of Comprehensive Immigration Reform that could lead to a path to citizenship, this year offers a historic opportunity for immigrant organizations and movements to build up their leadership and capacity for powerful community organizing. And we believe strong community organizing will lead to greater systemic change, including immigration reform as defined and prioritized by the communities themselves. Therefore, we are open to funding organizations that are taking a variety of positions for and against the CIR bill(s), or no position at all. Our priority is to help organizations use this historic moment to build stronger community organizing. 

Has your organization taken a position on the immigration reform bill(s) currently being considered in Congress? Are you... 
a) endorsing it, 
b) opposing it, 
c) in the process of developing a position, 
d) taking no position, or
e) other? 
Please explain.

How are you using the current momentum around immigration reform to build up your own organization and movement?
